instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2530 no PP5V_S3_REG
threads.message:
Back with another difficult one :). Attached images show what I tested. Since I have 3.3v from 7200 can I assume the Chip is working fine, although 5v is not coming out? So im trying now to troubleshoot the enable signal but cant find any issues yet, accept for one R that showed wrong, see image description.

On a sidenote, my customer told me he used the mac for quite some time with a defect fan, maybe something fried. The board looks nice though and I have green + orange light on charger.

Greetz
Arno

threads.title: 820-2530 no PP5V_S3_REG
threads.message: These do not auto power on. Did you try to power on by shorting C5710? See if PM_PWRBTN_L toggles when you short C5710.
